title: Quiz 5: STIs, Sexual Health & Harmful Practices
description: Tests knowledge on Sexually Transmitted Infections, Infertility, Sexual Dysfunction, and Harmful Traditional Practices.

questions.question: Match the STI to its classification (Curable vs Incurable):
questions.explanation: Bacterial STIs (Syphilis, Gonorrhea) can be cured with antibiotics. Viral STIs (Herpes, HIV) cannot be cured, only managed.

questions.question: Which organism causes Syphilis?
questions.explanation: Syphilis is caused by the bacterium Treponema pallidum.

questions.question: What is the main advantage of the 'Syndromic Approach' to STI management?

options.text: It uses expensive lab tests for accuracy
It allows immediate treatment at first contact without lab delays
It treats only one specific organism

questions.explanation: The syndromic approach treats signs/symptoms immediately, avoiding delays caused by lack of lab facilities.

questions.question: __1__ infertility is defined as when a woman has never been pregnant and cannot conceive after one year of unprotected sex.
questions.explanation: Primary infertility refers to couples who have never conceived. Secondary is after a previous pregnancy.

questions.question: Which of the following are considered Harmful Traditional Practices (HTPs)? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: FGM, food taboos, dry sex, and early marriage are harmful. Exclusive breastfeeding is a recommended beneficial practice.
questions.hint: Identify practices that negatively affect health.

questions.question: Match the sexual dysfunction to its definition:

pairs.right: Inability to control timing of release

questions.explanation: Dyspareunia = pain; Vaginismus = spasm; ED = erection failure.

questions.question: Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID) is a major complication of untreated STIs and can lead to:
questions.explanation: PID causes scarring of the fallopian tubes, blocking eggs (infertility) or trapping fertilized eggs (ectopic pregnancy).

questions.question: What is the acronym for the virus that causes AIDS?
Vaginal douching is a recommended practice to maintain hygiene and prevent infections.
questions.explanation: False. Douching upsets the natural bacterial balance (flora) and can increase the risk of infections.
questions.hint: Does it help or harm natural balance?

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of 'Gender-Based Violence'?
questions.explanation: Spousal battering is a form of physical violence against women based on gender dynamics.
questions.hint: Violence directed at someone because of their gender.
